EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position (2.5, 17.5)
• Input Chest at Position (2.5, 17.5) serving as the factory interface storage.
• Burner Inserter at Position (3.5, 17.5), placed with direction RIGHT; it is meant to transfer items into the factory process (reported with low fuel and waiting for source items).
• Burner Inserter at Position (2.5, 16.5) with warnings “out of fuel” and “inserter waiting for source items.”
• Burner Inserter at Position (1.5, 17.5) carrying fuel (coal) to support material movement.
• Assembling Machine at Position (1.5, 19.5) operating on the copper cable recipe.

──────────────────
### Depot Belt System at Position (3.5, 15.5)
• Wooden Chest at Position (3.5, 15.5) deployed as a belt depot.
• Transport Belt Segment at Position (4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest.
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position (3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP) to facilitate item transfer from the depot.

──────────────────
### Extraction System at Position (–3.5, 27.5)
• Extraction Burner Inserter at Position (–3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (–3.5, 28.5) for routing extracted resources.
• Wooden Chest at Position (–3.5, 26.5) (likely serving as an output buffer).

──────────────────
### Electricity Generator at Position (–0.5, 24.5)
• Steam Engine (Generator) at Position (–0.5, 24.5) intended for power production.
• Boiler at Position (–5.5, 24.0) supplying heated water/steam.
• Offshore Pump at Position (–7.5, 25.5) providing water input.

──────────────────
### Science Lab
• Lab equipped with lab_input {automation-science-pack: 17} to support research (position not specified).

──────────────────
### Smelting Facility
• Stone Furnace at Position (–3.0, 19.0) producing iron plates (result: 5 iron plates).
• Stone Furnace at Position (–4.0, 21.0) producing copper plates (result: 6 copper plates).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – When connecting transport belts, verify that the target entity is not a steam engine. Instead, use an inserter that funnels items into the generator. This avoids the repeated “cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object” error.

• Entity Placement Distance Errors
  – Ensure that the player is close enough to the target position before placing an entity. This prevents placement failures due to being out of range (e.g. target position (3.5,15.5) being too far from the default player position).

• Inventory Availability Errors
  – Confirm that the required entity (such as a wooden chest) is present in the inventory before attempting placement. This will help avoid errors stating “No wooden_chest in inventory.”

• Variable Name Errors
  – Check for proper definition of variables in the code (for example, ensuring ‘target_chest’ is defined) so that naming mistakes do not cause runtime errors.
